intro: Amphiglossa thuja, commonly known as the golden thread, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant features finely divided, feathery leaves that give it a delicate appearance. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. The roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
